desc: SHQ1 (SHQ1, H/ACA ribonucleoprotein assembly factor) is located on chromosome 3p13. SHQ1 is suggested to function in rRNA processing and has been shown to be involved in the formation of a protein-RNA complex (snoRNP [small nucleolar ribonucleoprotein]) known as the H/ACA box (PMID: 19383767, 12228251). The H/ACA box is involved in processing of rRNA, modifications of species of RNAs, and stabilization of telomeres (PMID: 20227365, 19383767). SHQ1 are shown to bind NAP57, which is an essential member of H/ACA, prior to the binding of another accessory protein, NAF1, and is thought to assist in the shuttling of the complex to nucleoli (PMID: 20227365, 19383767). SHQ1 contains a protein-protein interaction domain known as the CS domain (named after CHORD-containing proteins and SGT1) which appears to be essential for H/ACA complex formation (PMID: 19426738, 19019820). The genetic locus of SHQ1 is frequently deleted in prostate cancers and one somatic mutations has been observed (PMID: 20579941).

articles.title: The Shq1p.Naf1p complex is required for box H/ACA small nucleolar ribonucleoprotein particle biogenesis.
articles.reference: Yang PK et al. The Journal of biological chemistry. 2002 Nov 22;277(47)45235-42.

articles.title: The box H/ACA snoRNP assembly factor Shq1p is a chaperone protein homologous to Hsp90 cochaperones that binds to the Cbf5p enzyme.
articles.reference: Godin KS et al. Journal of molecular biology. 2009 Jul 10;390(2)231-44.

articles.title: SHQ1 is required prior to NAF1 for assembly of H/ACA small nucleolar and telomerase RNPs.
articles.reference: Grozdanov PN et al. RNA (New York, N.Y.). 2009 Jun;15(6)1188-97.

articles.title: Structure and functional studies of the CS domain of the essential H/ACA ribonucleoparticle assembly protein SHQ1.
articles.reference: Singh M et al. The Journal of biological chemistry. 2009 Jan 16;284(3)1906-16.

articles.title: Integrative genomic profiling of human prostate cancer.
articles.reference: Taylor BS et al. Cancer cell. 2010 Jul 13;18(1)11-22.

articles.title: Box H/ACA small ribonucleoproteins.
articles.reference: Kiss T et al. Molecular cell. 2010 Mar 12;37(5)597-606.

desc: SHQ1 is a nucleocytoplasmic shuttle protein with function in rRNA processing pathways. Loss of SHQ1 is frequently observed in prostate cancer.
